Articles.Content:
I went through a couple tutorials and sources and decided to make a plugin. I realized that while ascending I sometimes forget to watch the heat my engines are creating. So I made a warning message pop up in the middle of your screen and play a warning sound. I was thinking of doing warnings for low fuel too.

I used the RCS thruster part for now, I am going to be looking at modeling a bit later.

Download

https://www.dropbox.com/s/80o7myr3c0b1mmi/HeatWarn.zip

Source

https://github.com/mojobojo/KSPHeatWarn

Edited July 8, 2013 by mojobojo
I like this idea, go for it. Might I suggest a low altitude one too for aircraft.

Very nice!

this could work well with people who hate MechJeb but don't like warningless disintegration of 1/3 of thier craft.
This plugin has saved me so many times. Thank you!
Oh thank goodness. I've not had nearly the issues I used to since I learned to put something between the engine and the tanks, but I still hate that you can't see the engine icons on the map screen.
Another useful option would be low fuel warning. For example when craft has 10% of fuel left.

Another useful option would be low fuel warning. For example when craft has 10% of fuel left.

I will try to get to adding some more features to it here soon. I had almost forgotten I made this plugin. I am also going to look at modeling a part so I am not using an RCS model.

Edited July 26, 2013 by mojobojo

How about making a partless version?

For now I've simply added module heatwarn to the lvn and mainsail because they are the only engines that tend to explode anyway.
